Since it was only me and my husband, we didn't use the sofa bed. It would have been good for our son if he would have went. I liked the convenience of the mini kitchen, but it did not have a microwave. It did have a refrigerator and single-cup coffee maker. The bathroom had a deep tub with jets for a nice relaxing bath. I loved the Bath and Body Works soaps and shampoos they give you (like other reviewers). CLEAN/SAFE: Overall, the place seemed secure. Security rides around in little carts. Parking is free. Housekeeping did a good job. The room and whole resort was clean. No bugs. They should do something about the scent of cat urine by the garden wedding area though. A couple of cats like to hang out there. The scent kind of ruins the pretty scenery. TAXI fare to the strip is going to run you $8 - $10 USD. Walking to the strip would not be fun because its kind of far away and there's a lot of traffic. Unless you like to walk for hours because the strip itself is a major walking experience. You could walk to the Hard Rock Hotel/Cafe which is right across the street. We spent about $60 in taxi fare while we were there to avoid drinking and driving. Next time I think it would be equal just to pay a little more for a room on the strip instead of getting taxis, but I would stay here again otherwise.

Mar 18 2007 	Perfect for a non-gambling family	My family loved the Alexis Park. My husband and I dont gamble at all and obviously our 3 teenagers can't. We came to Vegas for 2 nights just to experience what the city is like and we wanted to see the Hoover Dam. The hotel was right off the strip so we could still see it and visit some of the big-time hotels. I would definitely siggest this hotel if you want a quiet, relaxed stay in Vegas but you still want the oppurtunity to experience the city (outside of the hotel walls).by the way- the breakfast was great

Mar 4 2007 	Just Right for Me A Non-Gambler	It was not like the MGM or the Mirage. It was not flashy nor glamour. The setup of my room was like my apartment, but much more spacious. Staff were friendly and helpful. Parking was ample and right next to my room. This is the place for people who don't care for the smoke, lights and noise of the big Vegas high rise hotels. I felt like home there.

Feb 26 2007	NBA weekend	My daughter's entire volleyball team was booked into this hotel and not once before we checked in were we told that there would be TWO nights of blaring music from pre-booked parties coming from their convention room and surrounding areas celebrating the NBA All Star game. Our girls were dragging for two days of tournament play, where college coaches are scouting for the best players. What a travesty for these girls. But the worst part of the weekend was trying to book an audience with the general manager to discuss our plight and she just just blew us off.

Feb 7 2007 	Not Too Bad	Just returned from Vegas, stayed at Alexix Park for 3 days. It's a interesting layout with about 28 separate low rise buildings. Each suite is two story, living room, 1 1/2 baths, fireplace, and a jacuzzi on the staircase. Note: for us gambling addicts, no casino in this hotel. Nearest casino is the Hard Rock Hotel across the street, but take care in crossing as it's a very busy and dangerous boulevard. If you stay in this hotel, you might be doing a lot of walking. In our case, we were housed on the far end of the property,so it's a good hike. We heard some scary stories from other folks on this website, but we had no major problems. The water pressure is really low in the showers. You might want to take heed of some of the concerns over security at this hotel as there is no way for them to secure these buildings from outsiders. I didn't leave my wife alone in the room at any time as I had read about some unfortunate incidents. Please note the check-in time posted is 4 p.m./ Seemed kind of late for a modern hotel, as the check-out time is listed at 11 :00 a.m.It's okay if you don't mind some inconveniences.

Jan 29 2007	It's Ok	The Alexis Park is nice enough. We stayed there because of a convention my partner was attending and I went along for the free ride. So, considering her company picked up the tab I can't complain. However, for review purposes I'm giving it a neutral rating. It's fairly nice on the outside and walking distance to the Strip (I made the walk a couple times). The landscaping is nice and while it was too cold to swimp the pool was pleasant to sit around in the sun. I also got an hour massage onsite - it cost $100 which was rather pricey - I could get the same back home for $60 - $70, but for the convenience I s'pose it was worth it. They've a nice little gym onsite - nothing fancy, but clean and functional. There was also a hot tub and sauna in the women's changing room (and I assume the same in the men's).Based on all of the above I would've given it an 'above average' rating (four circles), but the rooms knocked them down a bit. They were ok - clean and we had room service daily - the TV's and heater worked, etc, but the beds were small (but the brochure DID say two double beds), and the bathroom was pretty outdated and needed some repairs. To give the old tiles some new life they'd painted over them - and did a pretty good job, except where the paint was chipping off. The bathrooms really just needed a remodel to deal with poor lighting and skewed cabinet doors, etc.Considering the price ($169) and location I would probably stay here with friends, again (split four ways it becomes much more reasonable).

Jan 7 2007 	No Heat Your Problem	Las vegas on New Years was great unless this Hotel is the one you booked. We stayed in a suite for 2 nights. The first night we called to let them know that the heat was not working thinking that they would get it fixed while we were out with friends. We came back the second night late New Years. Still no heat, we called again they sent out maintence to tell us that it was not working. we complained to the front office they did not even say that they were sorry. Quailty service was not on the menu at this all suites resort. I would never recommend this place to anyone it is falling apart and they treat the customers like they are an inconvience. I did get an extra blanket instead of heat. But for $250.00 dollars a night what should a consumer expect?

Jan 4 2007 	Great for the Price Quiet and Close to the Action	I was recently here for New Years and thought it was a great deal. Dec 12 2006 	Alexis park -- a nice *2* star hotel	I booked this property on hotwire, and I was very skeptical of the hotel once I read other reviews on tripadvisor. I even attempted (unsuccessfully) to get my rooms booked somewhere else through hotwire.I dont know where all the tweakers and street-walkers come from, but they seem to congregate near the hotel. Im not sure if they are living in one of the many construction areas near the hotel or what. Maybe this is a problem for the entire city of Las Vegas...It did not feel like a safe place at night. The lighting was ok, but left several areas in shadows. This place is HUGE with several hundred rooms spread out over probably 50+ acres. If you get a shuttle to the hotel from the airport, be prepared to walk over a 1/4 mile to your room.2 of the 3 pools were under severe reconstruction while we were there. Our room cards couldn't access the 3rd and final pool, and we were told by the front desk that our cards won't work when the pool is closed. (I guess it was closed at 11 am).The carpet was new in our room, and the bed was clean and comfortable. The furniture was newly updated. The tile in the bathroom is painted, though. The room was clean, though calling it a kitchen is a stretch since there was no microwave or stove, only a dorm fridge.We didnt get a fully stocked bathroom (shampoo and conditioner), so I left $5 for houskeeping as a tip for our second night. We were suprised to find the bathroom stocked with extras (on top of our shampoo and conditioner that was missing from the night before) with items such as mouthwash and lotion. Bathroom items were from Bath and Body Works, so this was $5 well spent. My wife estimates the value at probably close to $10.The room did not have a good reception on the TV. Cable didnt work, and the reception required the use of an antenna. Only about 5 fuzzy channels were available. Our friends had working cable only 3 doors away. Cable seems to be hit or miss based upon which room you get (luck of the draw). The internet appears to be the same way.Overall, I give this a solid 2 star hotel, but not 3. They really need to work out security issues, and give the whole thing better lighting (inside and out). Calling it an all-suite hotel is also a major stretch. So is comparing it to a Residence Inn or Courtyard, or Embassy suites. It IS on par with most Best Westerns or Clarion or Holiday Inns, though. If you booked through a non-refundable website you shouldn't worry. This was a comfortable place.I still feel that hotwire selling me this hotel as comparable to a Embassy suites 3 star hotel is fraud, but that is a battle for another day.

Dec 4 2006 	Great place for the price but be careful with the reservation	I stayed in this hotel for three nights early November and when I arrived I was very dissapointed to see the "Monarch suite" which for me was only a big room. This hotel is about a mile from the strip but next to the Hard Rock Cafe. Nov 20 2006	Pretty place - don't skip due to previous reviews.	After reading previous reviews, several of which were negative, I wanted to write a fairly positive review. This hotel is in the process of improvements, some of which are visible, some of which are not. The grounds are very pretty and well-kept. It has been somewhat updated, but still needs some work. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We ate dinner in the restaurant and were pleasantly surprised. The food was good and the service, tho somewhat slow, was ok. The room was huge with a living room, large bar area with sink and fridge, and a large bedroom. The bath needed some updating, but had a jacuzzi tub.The bar was a little dark, but the bartender was friendly.If you have a reason to stay off the strip, this place is a reasonable choice, and reasonably priced.

Nov 19 2006 	Good but lacking	Stayed at this place for 3 nights in November. On the good side, the location is pretty good (near the Hard Rock). Here's the list of things I noticed:-Televisions cannot get many channels due to some strange radio interference. -The plumbing in the room is falling apart and is sealed in a sloppy way-The cardio equipment in the gym is almost all out of order. This includes both treadmills. -The sauna and steamroom are both brokenI read one review that says that the place is being re-done. Oct 21 2006 	A work in progress	I just returned from a 4 night stay at this property. I was nervous after reading reviews here, but had a very positive experience. I was attending a conference in the hotel. This is an older resort with many 2 story buildings built around a center garden with pathways and 3 pools. It is a popular spot for garden weddings - they have several small weddings per evening on weekends.The resort is in process of being updated. My room in one of the building near the front of the resort had been redone. ( buildings 11-19 have been redone) It was a spacious room with comfortable double bed, a wetbar, with fridge, microwave and coffemaker and sitting area with sofa and club chair. The bath was large with an oval tub and lots of good towels. The hotel offers free parking and is only about 1/2 mile walk to the strip. The resort does not offer a casino which was a plus. It is a good value.

Oct 17 2006 	Dangerous break-in	Alexis Park Resort and Spa turned out to be a dangerous place. We woke up to an intruder the first morning. She had broken in the bathroom window. Sep 26 2006	Much better than I expected	I was reluctant to stay here after reading negative reviews but I decided to give the positive reviews a chance. I was pleasantly surprised when I opened the door and found a spacious room equipped with the amenities I expect to find in motels.While the rooms aren't new, it is obvious that the intent of the owners is to offer a great value for the price.I'm looking forward to the rest of my stay and will certainly consider the Alexis for future visits to Las Vegas

Sep 25 2006 	Better than expected	I attended a conference here the second week of September, 2006, so I had little choice on staying here. I was skeptical about the place based on earlier reviews, but I have to admit that it isn't as bad as reported.I got the impression that management was making efforts to update the resort, but they can only do so much at once. For instance, the sofa was old but the beds were great. The A/C was new in both the living room and bedroom, but the TV channel selection left a lot to be desired. Who goes to Vegas to watch TV anyway? My room had a kitchenette, but all it had was a sink, bar fridge, and a one-cup coffee maker. No microwave, burners or utensils. The room was clean, and the jacuzzi tub worked. All 3 pools were open and clean, and they had a better than average fitness room.The maid service was prompt and efficient. The other hotel staff I encountered wasnt very helpful. When I checked in, there was a bellboy hanging around behind the front desk, but he didn't offer to help with the bags. He was more interested in asking the desk clerk out on a date. While I was checking in! Anyway, the conference facilities were adequate if you forget about the A/C failing in the conference area for a day and a half. The resort is exactly one mile from the Strip, so be prepared to walk a bit to enjoy the sites. The Hard Rock casino is right across the street if you can't. Taxis were usually not around, and had to be called by the front desk. The East Harmon area isnt bad, but it is more secluded at night than the Strip. Although the place is OK, I wouldn't stay here again because there are so many better hotel options in Vegas.

Jul 18 2006	Dark and scary	Had to stay here for a competition with my daughter. Room was old and not the cleanest I have every stayed in. Fortunately the air conditioner worked great. Outdoor coridors are dark and a little scary at night. There were a couple of times we were at the pool and thought the airplanes were going to land on top of the hotel. Staff is extremely incompetent. I knew more about Las Vegas than they did and they were not interested in finding out the answers. Taxis are non existent. If you need one, they will not call one for you. A bellman stands in the shrubs out front and blows a whistle. If you are lucky one will stop within 20 - 30 minutes. I would defintely not stay here again on my own choice.
Jul 13 2006	Stay Away!	I can' t believe this place can stay in business. Dirty, bad service, things falling apart,,,,

Jul 13 2006	Making Improvements	I've stayed at the Alexis Park three times in the past year in preperation for an upcoming conference. Over that time I have seen quite a lot of improvement by the new management. The pool and grounds have always been nice. They have a top notch gym - better than most hotel and rarely used. The Lobby/regisrtation area was being renovated during my last trip and is going to be nice. The rooms and exterior painting are still being worked, but you can see the improvmenet from month-to-month. the bottom line is this hotel is not a $300/night hotel and you are not going to get that type of service/ or accomodations. What it is going to be is a clean, respectable hotle at a very reasonable rate close to the strip.

Jul 6 2006	Good deal in Las Vegas	On my recent visit to Las Vegas I stayed at the Alexis Park and it was my third time at the hotel. During the booking of the room I noticed negative feedback on the property and thought only fair to provide my perspective based on multiple visits. I have always found the rooms clean and the beds comfortable and have felt it is a good value for my dollar. I also liked the fact that it is a non-gaming location so I do not have to go through a smokey casinso floor to get to the factilities. I was concerned this visit because of the summer temps and whether the air conditioning would provide adequate cooling, I had to get up in the middle of the night and turn it down it was doing such a good job! If you are expecting the Ritz it is not the place for you but if you want a comfortable location at a reasonable price it is definitely a great place to stay.

Jul 6 2006	Don't know what all the bad press is about.....	I stayed at this location in June with some trepidation, based on the reviews I had read. To my surprise I found not one, but three pools available for swimming. There appeared to be managment interest in improving the property, as we noticed workmen on-site both days. My room was clean, and large. The bed and bedding were comfortable, and the air conditioning worked well - thank goodness - it was well over 100 degrees both days! I will definitely stay at the Alexis Park on my next visit to Las Vegas.

Jul 6 2006	Ok for the money - but not the greatest option	I stayed at the Alexis in April (2006) for a convention of cigar smokers - probably not their run-of-the-mill convention they hold there. I didn't give the resort 3-stars, as there are problems. If you are in the front part of the resort, the buildings look a bit more maintained - fresher paint jobs, a bit more tidy on the upkeep, etc. Toward the back of the resort, though, they really need to fix things like windows, the paint/stucco jobs, etc. For some reason, one of the pools (not the one near my building, thankfully) was closed the entire weekend I was there. As they feature it on their Web site as an "evening and meeting focal point" for socializing/etc., one would think they would maintain it a bit better.The service was very nice, I will say. The desk staff were very kind and courteous, as I arrived earlier in the day and my room was not ready. (I was very early.) The hotel allows you to check your baggage securely, so that was fine. Housekeeping was adequate, though I must say they were very noisy. My room was changed every day, but there was nothing extrodinary in the service. The resort is not 4-star, so I wasn't expecting much.Very frustrating, however, was the air conditioner/heater in my bedroom. The one in the living room/lounge area worked fine, but the one in the bedroom refused to operate correctly. When set on "cool" - it was about 78-degrees outside when I was there, after all- the unit gave out heat instead. Had I wanted to do Bikram yoga in my bedroom, it would have been ideal. After reporting the unit not working, it never was fixed. I had to rely on the unit in the living room to keep this cool. Also, the phone in the bedroom did not work at all. One other note. If you stay in the back part of the resort, you'll have a nice, healthy walk as the resort is spread out quite a bit. It's well-lit at night, though, and seems relatively safe for not being gated or anything. Overall, it was ok for the value. I really wasn't there at the resort for the resort itself - more for the convention and to explore Vegas for the first time. The location is nice, though, being just far enough from the Strip that you can get away from all the noise and tour bus-loads of gawking tourists. The hotel is a good 15-minute walk from the Strip, and if the weather is not too warm, a quick/easy walk. Hoffbrauhaus is nearby (for big German beers and even bigger German dinners - om pa pa!), as is Mr. Lucky's at the Hard Rock Casino (great for a quick breakfast, and ask for the $7.77 steak/shrimp/salad meal deal that is not on the menu). If you're used to everything being neat, tidy, ultra modern, look elsewhere. If, however, you're on a budget (or get a deal staying here, in my case), don't mind being away from the noise of the Strip, and can look past things like malfunctioning air conditioner units (ok, was a bit of a problem) and cracking stucco that needs repaired already, you could do worse. Not terrible, but they need to improve things to polish their image a bit. I'd rather spend a few bucks more the next time, put up with some of the Strip noise, and get better quality/service.

Jun 8 2006	Tired Dirty 	We went to a Hilton Time Share fiasco but stayed two nights in a clean new suite at their Grand Vacation Club. Can't say enough about those rooms. Nice. Then we moved to the Alexis Park. One TV was hotwired thru a hole in the wall to pick up the limited cable selection. We had to 'jiggle' the wire to see thru the static on the screen. The main room had dirty carpeting, a refrig that had seen better days and dirty windows. The jacuzzi had not worked in years. There was a lot of wind while we stayed there and no one made any effort when the winds died down to pick up the palm fronds and papers that stuck in all the scary dark overhangs. No one was allowed in the main pool ?? something about ins. One pool was filled with palm fronds and the other one was full of kids there for basketball and baseball tournaments.The staff we encountered were friendly and the receptionist went online to print out our boarding passes for us. We are flying into Vegas in July to drive to Palm Desert and will spend two nights there before we return home. I will stay out in Henderson if I have to before I would stay at that dirty worn out Alexis Park. With all the bulldozing and building in Vegas, I am surprised it is still standing.

Jun 5 2006	Barely tolerable!	My husband and I stayed at the Alexis (despite my gut feeling and the poor reviews here on TA) over the CRAZY BUSY Cinco de Mayo weekend. We didn't want to shell out the exhorbitant prices at the nice strip hotels (200 and up) for our quick three day break from reality. Pros of Alexis -- hot water, clean bed/bedding and pretty close proximity to center strip (25 min. walk in a pretty safe but not all sidewalked area), quiet pool area to sun ourselves each AMCons -- musty smelling room, very worn furniture (some to the point of being dangerous), no shuttle to Strip, main pool was closed (they said because of no lifeguard)We had planned on using the Hard Rock Hotel shuttle (which Alexis had recommended) but you have to cross a busy 6-lane highway (EAST HARMON) and the line for the shuttle there was very LONG the nights we were there.If you want to know about the rest of our time --Despite the Alexis, we had an incredible time in Vegas. The money we saved on our room we used to gamble and I got lucky at the quarter slots one night, winning over $350. For our big "show" we saw Cirque de Soleil Ka at MGM which we absolutely LOVED. (Although my husband said he still likes "O" best). Oh, and the MGM Buffet Dinner was excellent, at $29.99 that night.So, my advice is, if you can absolutely avoid the Alexis, do so, but it's okay in a pinch. I would much prefer to stay at the Aladdin (or whatever it's new name is now) which usually has decent rates (except on that particular weekend...) and yet is pretty classy and accessible to everywhere we like to visit.

May 27 2006 	Overall Dirty Feeling	We would never stay here again. During our 5 night stay, I never felt clean or safe. To drive to our room, we passed open dumpsters, trash spilling out. There were bugs in the bathroom, dirty tissues under the bed. The first room we were assigned had air conditioners on the wall that had pieces hanging from them, dust filled and did not cool the rooms. We were switched to a newly "renovated" room and it had a new air conditioner, which was fine, but newly "renovated" was a laugh. Hotwire claims it is a three star and books it as a "Resort" but don't make the mistake I did and hope that you are finding a fantastic deal on Hotwire, it is a misrepresentation and a sad place to stay in Vegas.

Mar 20 2006	What a dreadful stay!!!	We stayed at the Alexis Park 2 years ago and had a very pleasant stay, so decided to return and booked a loft suite...Big mistake!On arrival, used trays of food were outside our room. Mar 15 2006	Don't panic!!! It's going to be OK	Quick review: The outside buildings look like a cheap motel and are a bit shabby (cracking paint and plaster). However, the room we had (2257) was very spacious, clean and everything worked as advertised. Considering the reviews we read, I feared the worst, but it turned out much better than expected. If you are looking for affordable accommodations and don't mind being off the strip, this is not a bad place to stay.FULL REVIEW:------------------------------------------------------My wife and I booked our rooms through Hotwire and were given accommodations at Alexis Park Resort. Naturally, the first thing I did was read reviews...and boy, was I worried! Usually you have to take Trip Advisor reviews with a grain of salt, read between the lines and such. But when I saw the shear number of horrible reviews, I really got worried. When we arrived, the outer buildings reminded me of a large but cheap motel. The paint is peeling, the plaster is cracked, and from the outside you would expect the rooms to be really small. But that was the only bad impression we had.First, the lobby was clean and decorated nicely (if a bit modestly) and the employees behind the counter were attentive and efficient. Next, our room was very large and well-appointed (for an $80/night room) and everything was clean and tidy. The bed sheets were clean, the shower worked fine, the bed was very comfortable and there were no bad odors in our non-smoking room. As for pests, my wife is VERY susceptible to flea and other critter bites and she had absolutely no problems. And finally, we did not encounter any problems with check-in or double billing as some people reported.My only complaints are that they had limited cable television (no premium cable at all - this means we missed the season opening of Sopranos) and that the bathroom did not have a heat lamp. Usually, Vegas doesn't need heat lamps, but this was pre-spring and it was chilly at night. Finally, the "kitchen" is just a small fridge and sink (we were hoping that kitchen meant stove/oven).Overall, I was very pleased with the accommodations and would recommend this to anyone who is looking for affordable accommodations who don't mind being off the strip. (The Hard Rock Casino is very close, and I recommend Mr. Lucky's for breakfast.) In conclusion, if you bought your accommodations from Hotwire and are getting nervous, relax, don't panic. It'll be fine. We had non-smoking room 2257 and it was very pleasant.

Mar 5 2006	Is everyone used to staying at the Four Seasons?	I am reading all of these bad reviews, and I am just thinking to myself...how prissy are half of these people? I stayed one night on Friday March 3rd and was actually surprised at how nice the room was. This was my third trip to vegas in the past year, so I travel there quite a bit. My boyfriend and I stayed at Mandalay Bay for the first 3 nights and due to the ridiculous Friday night weekend rates, we opted to get a $116 room at Alexis on the last night. It was not bad at all. It was his first time ever in Vegas and I wanted to make it special by getting a room on the strip, but he was actually kind of mad at me, by not getting our room at Alexis for the whole week, so that we could have had saved more money for the trip.I was a little worried at first due to the outside decor looking a bit "spray-painted", but when I entered the room I was happily surprised. It had a little kitchenette w/ fridge, a couch, chair, and with exception of the bedspread the room was very nicely decorated. The bathroom was a good size, with a garden bathtub, and had Bath & Body Works as the shampoo, soap and lotion in the room. It was clean, and I must admit, it was a very nice change not being in a "gaming" hotel that is too crowded, and where we didn't have to walk a mile from the parking lot to our room. Alexis is not on the strip, but that's not necessarily a bad thing. It is located a half a mile away, plus it is right across the street from the Hard Rock. If you are looking for something quiet and inexpensive, (believe me you will spend enough money on food and everything else), Alexis is a good place to stay.

Feb 26 2006	It's a dump! Stay away!!!	This place is in dire need of repairs. Feb 22 2006	What a dump!	We stayed at this hotel because of a convention being held there. The only way I can imagine this hotel getting a good review is if there are maybe a handfull of nice rooms. I didn't hear of a single person from the 140 rooms booked for our convention that ended up in a good one. The bed looked like a giant bowling ball had been dropped on it. The room was in sad need of a good cleaning and paint. This hotel boasted that the rooms were 'suites'. What it really was like was the cheap college dorms I lived in 25 yrs ago. Very out dated and run down.Friends of ours had their room changed 3 times before they got a bed that wasn't broken. We heard of several other disappointed couples that also had to change rooms because of the beds. There is no wireless internet, the TV channels were hard to see, the remote and the keyboard for internet on the TV did not work. We called up to the desk for a coupole of hours but nobody ansered the phone. We called every other extension - housekeeping, ect. Same thing - no answer. Finally we got in the car and drove (we were in one of the buildings the most distant from the front desk) and there was only one person there who said she never heard the phone ring and that she would send someone to fix the remote. No one ever came.We followed the lead of several others and after the first creepy night, checked out and stayed at the MGM Grand for only a few dollars more per night. The Alexis Park was very over priced for the tacky uncomfprtable mess they call an 'all suite hotel'. Don't be fooled by night time photos of this hotels pool area. The pool area looks nice by moonlight, and is by far the nicest area of the hotel, but is also in need of repair.

Feb 14 2006 	Hotel Hell	No lie, the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. I complained and they moved me to a "better room" at no extra charge. There were big water stains on the wall of the lower floor. Feb 14 2006 	Poor Customer Service	Credit goes to Alexis Park for huge rooms and suites in a Med/Tuscan style. It is also nice and quiet. If you want to gamble, it's a quick walk. I was here for a conference at the hotel so got to experience all types of staff interaction. The front desk customer service was terrible on multiple occassions on multiple different issues. Expect a pretty nice property, but don't expect service to match. Either staff was incompetent, not knowledgeable about basics of their property, or just not interested. Please note that my experience was echoed by several other guests during a Thursday to Sunday stay and the hotel was NOT full.All in all, I WOULD stay at the property again if I were driving into town and wanted a quiet resort and a more condo-like room with little interaction with staff. If I were going for resort with great attention to detail and service, then I'd go elsewhere.

Jan 5 2006	Stay for NYE 2006	Location, Price, and Room size! 2 thumbus up!I stayed here with bunch of my friends to celebrate NYE 2006. I can't complain for the price for 3 nights given a suite room. We're all budget traveler & I wanna say this hotel is outstanding in terms of the price, location, and room size. The room is big with a living room and bedroom upstairs. The place has a fabulous lobby, pools, and looks nice from the outside. It is less than 5 minute drive to the strip. I even walked to the hotel from the strip after NYE. If you're looking for a big room with a budget, try this hotel. It's worth for every single penny in Vegas.

Jan 4 2006	Horrible Customer Service	I booked this so called "resort" suite because it was supposed to be my honeymoon trip. Big mistake! The hotel is an embarassment to drive up to, I am not sure what they are trying to do with the paint job but it looks awful. The room appeared clean, although I did find a huge bug that looked prehistoric in the bathroom. The rooms are dated, the "spa" tub is very unusual. It seats two people but it is small and deep, not very comfortable. The gas fireplace did not work, it was not even connected! When my husband called maintence, they hung up on him twice because they said he was yelling at them. (He is slightly hard of hearing and does tend to have a louder voice but he was polite the whole time.)When my husband finally went to the lobby desk to see what was going on....that is when maintence showed up, while I was in the tub. It turns out that none of the fireplaces in certain buildings work because the gas is not hooked up!! We were given a "complimentary" buffet breakfast to try to make ammends for the troubles. Not only was the breakfast terrible, they charged it to my Visa which I found out on this last bill! When I called the hotel to let them know what happened, whoever answerd the phone said "HI!" and when I asked if this was the Alexis Resort, he said "yeah, it is". I had to call 4 times to get a hold of a manager. I have worked in customer service for almost 20 years and have never seen such uncaring staff. In the end, we only stayed one of our two scheduled days there. Needless to say, our honeymoon was memorable but not in a good way!

Dec 11 2005	Resort ? No Way !	This place is dirty, the floors in the rooms aren't even or flat, the place needs a major remodeling, it doesn't have half of the features the other Discount Resorts in Las Vegas have, and if you can find a staff member (except in reservations, of course) they don't have a clue about activities, features, times, and events at motel.With dozens of discount resorts in Las Vegas, don't even waste your time thinking about this one.

Nov 28 2005	Not a Kid or Soccer Place	We stayed here for a soccer tournament. The facility is somewhat dated, but it just doesn't seem well suited for kids. While there are outside pools, there weren't any kid friendly TV channels or other activities. Service was very "slow". We had to ask that we receive sheets for our sleeper sofa. After 3 attempts and a second visit to the office, we did get the sheets an hour later. This wasn't untypical during our stay. Maybe it is just typical of what we saw of many places appearing short staffed in Vegas.

Nov 21 2005	Much Better than expected	After reading some bad posts in here I was a little hesitant as to how this hotel was. Overall my experience was good, yes the outside of the hotel doesnt look great, but once we stepped in our room I was shocked to see that it was better than expected. We had the crown suite, it had a mini living room with a sofa bed, also a sink, a small coffee maker, a mini fridge, a closet and a restroom, upstairs it had the huge bed, and it was not uncomfortable, the shower was fine, this was my only problem very low pressure on the shower. In regards to the strip it is a little far if you walk, but in the car it's probably less than 5 minutes from the strip. The room was spotless when we got there and the maids cleaned it very well in this hotel. Parking was very convenient, that way you park right across your room. Overall, this was a good hotel, clean rooms, comfortble beds, close to the strip. I would not hesitate to come back to this hotel.

Nov 3 2005 	I love the smell of cow manure in the morning...	How this place could ever get a good review is beyond me. The entire property smells potently like a cattle farm. I assume they just fertilized the grass, but come on people, cow manure? It is also NOT safe here. I am a single female traveler and they put me in the building farthest from the lobby at the edge of the non-enclosed property where I had the privilege of being leered at by the construction workers at the property next door every time I went to my room. The bed feels exactly like the hide-a-bed on the circa 1975 couch my fiance refuses to discard. The shower has, for lack of a better word, weird goo around the drain. The hotel is on the approach path for airplanes landing at the airport so the building shakes about every 4 minutes as a huge 747 flies directly overhead. As I turned on the A/C unit over the desk, it exploded ice all over my laptop. Avoid at all costs.
